{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Wilson curve is a term used in dentistry to describe the curvature of the occlusal surface of the teeth. It refers to the curve that is present on the buccal (cheek) and lingual (tongue) surfaces of the teeth. The Wilson curve is most commonly seen in the posterior teeth, specifically the molars and premolars. Therefore, the correct answer is A. Molars and B. Premolars.", "answer_choice": "A"}
